case_title: MUHAMMAD AMIN IETC vs MIAN MUHAMMAD

key_issues.issue: Whether Mutation No. 33 dated 31-3-1955 was sanctioned fraudulently and is fictitious.
Whether the sale is void under Section 54 of the Transfer of Property Act due to non-registration.
Whether the suit is within time.
Whether the plaintiff received full consideration under the alleged sale.

mutation_32.details: Proprietary rights conferred to Mian Muhammad for Square No. 42, Killas Nos. 1 to 25, measuring 200 Kanals.

mutation_33.details: Oral sale of the same land to defendant-appellants for Rs. 22,000.

plaintiff_claims: Mutation No. 33 is fictitious and void.
Sale is null and void under Section 54 of the Transfer of Property Act.
defendant_position: Asserted possession and validity of the sale.

legal_principles.principle: Section 54 of the Transfer of Property Act
legal_principles.application: Sale held void due to non-registration.

legal_principles.principle: Section 42 of the Specific Relief Act
legal_principles.application: Relief is discretionary and denied due to plaintiff's conduct.

details: He who seeks equity must do equity.
No man shall take advantage of his own wrong.

reasoning: Plaintiff acted fraudulently and came with unclean hands.
Sale was void under Section 54 of the Transfer of Property Act.
Equitable principles favored the defendants in possession.
